definition: to lie through one's teeth (idiom)/to talk drivel
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]
to lie through one's teeth (idiom)/to talk drivel
pinyin: zheng1 zhe5 yan3 jing1 shuo1 xia1 hua4

definition: lit. to invert black and white (idiom); to distort the truth deliberately/to misrepresent the facts/to invert right and wrong
to twist words and force logic (idiom)/sophistry/loud rhetoric making up for fallacious argument/shoving false arguments down people's throats
lit. to strike with a muckrake (idiom), cf Pigsy 豬八戒|猪八戒 in Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记; fig. to counterattack/to make bogus accusations (against one's victim)
to speak off the cuff/to casually opine
the guilty party files the suit/the thief cries thief
to act shamelessly/to behave in a way that leaves others tut-tutting and shaking their heads in disapproval
to have no sense of shame
